intro: Hieracium pravipes, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium pravipes is often found in meadows, woodlands, and disturbed soils, thriving in a range of light conditions.
